Since the late 2000, there has been numerous companies attempting to build reputation aggregators for individuals.
        These systems would allow everyone to be rated online on how trustworthy or skilled their are, 
        the same way we rate restaurants on trip advisor. All the services presented here are now closed, but a
        second generation is coming, with for example the Chinese government's exhaustive social credit system.

The idea behind Klout, is to measure people's influence via social networks.
        "Now with social media, everyone has an audience, [...] it's this amazing change in the world where
        everyone now has influence, and we help everyone understand their influence and grow it."

CRED is not a replacement for a credit score – it is a personal, 
        financial credibility score and it’s a way for consumers to measure 
        their financial health in real-time everyday.

RapLeaf was founded in San Francisco by Auren Hoffman and Manish Shah in March 2005. 
        In May 2006 the Founders Fund led a seed round of about $1 million, including angel investors 
        such as Peter Thiel and Ron Conway. In June 2007 a second round included Founders Fund, 
        Rembrandt Venture Partners and included Conway. [...] The company's first product was a meta-reputation 
        system that allows users to create reviews and ratings of consumer transactions, which they then contribute 
        to multiple e-commerce websites.

TrustCloud (2009-2015) [was] a credit platform for Peer Marketplaces that measures virtuous 
        behavior online to build a portable and contextual trust score you can use anywhere.

Trust in the Sharing Economy

TrustCloud is a credit platform for the Sharing Economy that measures virtuous behavior online to build a portable and contextual trust score you can use anywhere.

We service the Sharing Economy by:

  • Verifying user identity with online & offline methods
  • Aggregating virtuous behavior from big social data
  • Detecting transactions, endorsements & ratings from sharing sites
  • Providing TrustBadges & TrustScores based on behavioral and transactional gestures that indicate trustworthiness
  • Making TrustCards portable & actionable
  • Sharing sites increase transaction volume, speed, and profit. Users get confidence, speed, and savings.
